results.title: Simvastatin attenuates intestinal fibrosis independent of the anti-inflammatory effect by promoting fibroblast/myofibroblast apoptosis in the regeneration/healing process from TNBS-induced colitis.
results.text_hl: The @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ cytokine (@GENE_TNF @GENE_7124 @@@TNF-alpha@@@) level significantly decreased in the mid- and late phases in the high-dose treatment group. (2) @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@SIMV@@@ also had anti-fibrotic effects characterized by a dose-dependent decrease in the level of a @<m>DISEASE_Growth_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006130 @@@fibrosis-related growth factor@@@ (@GENE_CCN2 @GENE_1490 @@@CTGF@@@) in the early and mid-phases, irrespective of @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammation@@@ or changes in the @GENE_TGFB1 @GENE_7040 @@@TGF-beta(1)@@@ level.

citations.NLM: Abe Y, Murano M, Murano N, Morita E, Inoue T, Kawakami K, Ishida K, Kuramoto T, Kakimoto K, Okada T, Narabayashi K, Umegaki E, Higuchi K. Simvastatin attenuates intestinal fibrosis independent of the anti-inflammatory effect by promoting fibroblast/myofibroblast apoptosis in the regeneration/healing process from TNBS-induced colitis. Dig Dis Sci. 2012 Feb;57(2):335-44. PMID: 21909991

results.title: Skin-specific regulation of SREBP processing and lipid biosynthesis by glycerol kinase 5.
results.journal: Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A
results.text_hl: Similar defective @DISEASE_Hair_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D006201 @@@hair@@@ growth was observed in kinase-inactive @GENE_GK5 @GENE_235533 @@@GK5@@@ mutant @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@. @<m>DISEASE_Growth_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006130 @@@Hair growth defects@@@ of homozygous toku @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@ were partially rescued by treatment with the @GENE_HMGCR @GENE_15357 @@@HMG-CoA reductase@@@ inhibitor @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@.

citations.NLM: Zhang D, Tomisato W, Su L, Sun L, Choi JH, Zhang Z, Wang KW, Zhan X, Choi M, Li X, Tang M, Castro-Perez JM, Hildebrand S, Murray AR, Moresco EMY, Beutler B. Skin-specific regulation of SREBP processing and lipid biosynthesis by glycerol kinase 5. Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A. 2017 Jun 27;114(26):E5197-E5206. PMID: 28607088

results.title: Differential effects of 3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaryl-coenzyme A reductase inhibitors on the development of myopathy in young rats.
results.text_hl: Administration via chow of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ (15 mg/kg of body weight/d) and @CHEMICAL_Lovastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008148 @@@lovastatin@@@ (43-55 mg/kg of body weight/d), both lipophilic, caused @<m>DISEASE_Growth_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006130 @@@stunted growth@@@, high creatine kinase (CK) activity in plasma, and severe @DISEASE_Muscular_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D009135 @@@myopathy@@@.

citations.NLM: Reijneveld JC, Koot RW, Bredman JJ, Joles JA, Bär PR. Differential effects of 3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaryl-coenzyme A reductase inhibitors on the development of myopathy in young rats. Pediatr Res. 1996 Jun;39(6):1028-35. PMID: 8725265
citations.BibTeX: @article{8725265, title={Differential effects of 3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaryl-coenzyme A reductase inhibitors on the development of myopathy in young rats.}, author={Reijneveld JC and Koot RW and Bredman JJ and Joles JA and Bär PR}, journal={Pediatr Res}, volume={39}, number={6}, pages={1028-35}}
